page.title: 14QUAKER PLOTS
page.content: About 1813 there was a small community of Quakers in Hoovers Lane who were given about 2 acres of land on which they built their bungalows and worked the land as market gardens.These continued as family concerns but some declined as their owners retired and died until today we have only one true Market Gardener who has worked the land since his father died and retails his produce on the side of the road.The rest of the properties have passed into the hands of private buyers, most of them very local. But there still remains on one of these old plots a grave with a headstone. They sunk wells and used the wind to generate low voltage electricity. Some were Beekeepers and very industrious in old age.The occupiers now have a Mains Water supply although you can see evidence of those former years.
